docs.lead_paragraph: Shlomit Levy Bard is a portrait photographer in California, who focuses her camera on families -- pregnant moms, birthing moms, infants and children. She began this particular specialty eight years ago as a way, she says, of "testing out what life is like in that world, figuring out if I wanted to be a mom, and whether I'd be able to pursue my ambitions at the same time."

headline.main: Lessons from a Pregnant Fighter Pilot

docs.abstract: A portrait photographer, a fighter pilot known as "Vapor" and their efforts to document a pregnancy and birth.
docs.snippet: A portrait photographer, a fighter pilot known as "Vapor" and their efforts to document a pregnancy and birth.

docs.lead_paragraph: And while we are on the subject of learning whether your child is a girl or a boy, Amanda Goehring, a corporate lawyer in Manhattan, wrote a very long and thoughtful response to the many comments here on the subject over the past few days. Before she and her husband, Brian, welcomed Christian, who is now 3, and Charles, who is two-and-a-half (yes, she has two children 54 weeks apart) there was Lucille. Or, at least, there was the idea of Lucille.
